name: Engineering Statistics and Quality Control

anti_reqs.name: Probability and Statistics for Business Applications
Probability and Statistics for Business Applications

long_desc: This is a course in introductory statistics for engineers with emphasis on modern product improvement techniques. Besides exploratory data analysis, basic probability, distribution theory and statistical inference, special topics include experimental design, regression, control charts and acceptance sampling.

custom_fields.goals: Given an engineering research question, students will be able to correctly identify variable types, choose appropriate graphs and visualizations, understand underlying randomness in data if applicable, and perform appropriate hypothesis tests to make decisions. Students will also be able to communicate their results.
custom_fields.key_topics: Exploratory data analysis, categorical/continuous variables, different data types, basic probability concepts, one/two variable hypothesis tests, the data analysis pipeline, interpreting and communicating results, exposure to experimental design/quality control.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Assignments, exams, and a final exam.
custom_fields.relevance: Students will gain an awareness and appreciation of the data analysis pipeline and be able to apply introductory level data analysis tools to problems arising in engineering.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Lecture slides, case studies, textbooks, websites, and articles.
